1_Bashans.summary: St. Mary, Mother of God, born in Nazareth to Joachim and Anna. An angel announced her birth, promising salvation. Queen of women, her intercession is sought.

2_Bashans.summary: Righteous man who lost wealth, children, and health but remained faithful. God restored his blessings; he died peacefully.
Disciple of St. Pachomius, became a monk, led with meekness, and departed after a life of asceticism.
Martyred in Doronka, Assuit, in 1096 A.M., endured torture, received the crown of martyrdom.

3_Bashans.summary: One of the seventy disciples, preached in Tarsus and Korkiras, performed miracles, died peacefully.
Priest from Fowwa, martyred under Diocletian by burning after torture. Body remains in Kalabsha.
86th Patriarch, scholar and ascetic, died in 1378 A.D. after 8 years.

4_Bashans.summary: First monk-patriarch, ordained in 496 A.D., focused on education, died peacefully after 8 years.
72nd Patriarch, faced Coptic persecution, died in 1166 A.D. after 18 years, added 'life-giving' to confession.

5_Bashans.summary: Prophet, son of Hilkiah, warned Israel against idolatry. Exiled to Babylon, wrote Lamentations, stoned to death in Egypt.

6_Bashans.summary: From Defra, martyred in El-Bahnasa after healing miracles, beheaded for faith.
Ascetic monk in Alexandria, led monasteries, performed miracles, died in 395 A.D.
Monk from El-Bandarah, departed after a holy life.

7_Bashans.summary: 20th Patriarch, refuted Arius at Nicea, exiled five times, wrote against Arianism, died in 373 A.D. after 45 years.

8_Bashans.event: Martyrdom of St. John of Senhout
8_Bashans.summary: From Senhout, confessed Christ, performed miracles, beheaded after torture.
Archpriest of Scetis, known for miracles and asceticism.

9_Bashans.summary: Empress, born in Edessa, found the True Cross in Jerusalem, built churches, died at 80 in 327 A.D.
89th Patriarch, from El-Maksa, faced persecution, died in 1452 A.D. after 24 years.
97th Patriarch, from Meer, ordained in 1587 A.D., died in 1603 A.D. after 15 years.

10_Bashans.event: Departure of the Three Hebrew Young Men
10_Bashans.summary: Hananiah, Azariah, Mishael, exiled to Babylon, refused idolatry, survived fiery furnace, died praying.

11_Bashans.summary: Wife of St. Justus, tortured in Sa El-Hagar, beheaded for faith, body preserved.
Monk and bishop, lived ascetically for 35 years, died after 32 years as bishop.

12_Bashans.summary: Church built for St. Demiana, martyred with 40 virgins, consecrated by Pope Alexandros.

12_Bashans.event: Relocation of St. John Chrysostom's Relics
12_Bashans.summary: Relics moved to Constantinople in 437 A.D., placed in the church of the Apostles.
Cross appeared in sky in 351 A.D., celebrated as a feast in Jerusalem.
106th Patriarch, ordained in 1745 A.D., died in 1769 A.D. after 23 years.
Scribe and manager, martyred in 1803 A.D. at Bab Zoweila, Cairo.

13_Bashans.summary: Tutor of emperors’ sons, became monk in Scetis, lived ascetically, died in 445 A.D. at 95.

14_Bashans.summary: Father of cenobitic monasticism, founded monasteries, died in 348 A.D.
From Pelusium, tortured and beheaded, performed miracles, body in El-Barmoun.

15_Bashans.event: Martyrdom of St. Simon the Zealot
15_Bashans.summary: Apostle, preached in Africa and Bertanah, crucified for faith.
Martyred under Diocletian after torture, received crowns of martyrdom.
Deacon and anchorite, commemorated for his holy life.

16_Bashans.event: Commemoration of St. John the Evangelist
16_Bashans.summary: Preached in Ephesus, wrote Gospel and Revelation, exiled to Patmos, saved sinners.

17_Bashans.summary: Bishop of Cyprus, converted from Judaism, wrote against heresies, died in 402 A.D.

18_Bashans.summary: Companion of St. Abraam, monk in Scetis, lived ascetically, died at 72.
Holy Spirit descended on disciples, who spoke in tongues.

19_Bashans.summary: Priest of El-Qalali, lived ascetically, mixed bread with ashes, ordained priest.
From Antioch, martyred at 12 with family under Diocletian, performed miracles.

20_Bashans.summary: Hermit, lived ascetically with wife as sister, built monasteries in El-Natroun, died in 357 A.D.

21_Bashans.summary: Mother of Christ, intercessor, brought salvation to humanity.
Monk in Palestine, resisted temptation, led a woman to repentance, died in Athens.

22_Bashans.summary: One of seventy disciples, preached with Junia, performed miracles, died peacefully.

23_Bashans.summary: One of seventy disciples, preached with Andronicus, buried him, died the next day.
Martyred with his mother in Alexandria for faith.

24_Bashans.summary: Jesus, Mary, and Joseph fled to Egypt, blessed the land, stayed in various places.
Minor prophet, prophesied Christ’s birth, died peacefully, church built in his name.
Monk in St. Macarius, burned alive in 1164 A.D. for refusing to convert.

25_Bashans.summary: From Antinoe, practiced medicine, tortured and beheaded, church built in his name.
Layman, built churches, gave to poor, served as chief scribe, died in 1795 A.D.

26_Bashans.summary: Apostle, preached in India, performed miracles, tortured and beheaded.

27_Bashans.summary: 30th Patriarch, monk and scholar, wrote against heresies, died in 516 A.D.
Brother of Mary and Martha, raised by Christ, bishop of Cyprus, died peacefully.

28_Bashans.summary: Body moved to Cyprus in 403 A.D., miracles occurred, buried in marble sarcophagus.

29_Bashans.event: Departure of St. Simon the Stylite
29_Bashans.summary: Born in Antioch, lived on pillar for 45 years, wrote teachings, died in 461 A.D.

30_Bashans.summary: 68th Patriarch, monk for 20 years, restored church properties, died in 1102 A.D.
One of seventy disciples, served Paul, preached to Jews and pagans, died peacefully.
